response: narrative=Dennis Burns was last seen at Seafield Road, Inverness, prior to attending a local outdoor festival with friends. Known for a recent escape from an abusive household, Dennis' whereabouts became a concern when he failed to return. Valerie Turner, involved in his previous foster arrangements, was notified. Searches focused on popular areas like the cemetery and library nearby. Family eventually traced him to Longman Drive, where he was found in good condition, though shaken, and returned home safely.

narrative=Dennis Burns was reported missing from his foster home on Seafield Road, causing immediate concern due to his young age and vulnerability. Known to enjoy the outdoors, Dennis often explored the local areas. He was last seen by his friend near the field adjacent to Shore Street, Inverness. Witnesses later reported seeing a boy resembling Dennis with Holly Reed walking near a cemetery off Smith Drive. Despite an extensive search in the surrounding wilderness, including fields and dense areas near 25 Southside Road, there was initially no trace of him. Fortunately, following a tip-off, Dennis was found safe and sound on Longman Road by the police.

narrative=Dennis Burns, a 12-year-old, was reported missing after visiting an arcade near 35 Cranmore Drive, Inverness, with friends. Despite poor weather conditions, the group ventured toward the fields adjacent to Coxton Park, Elgin, known for its vast stretches and open terrain. Unbeknownst to them, a foul weather incident quickly worsened, causing the group to become separated. While Dennis's friends managed to return safely, Dennis was not seen again in the immediate area. His foster family subsequently reported him missing from their residence on Seafield Road. Fortunately, Dennis was traced by family members the following day at Longman Drive, unharmed.

narrative=Dennis Burns, a 13-year-old boy, was living in foster care on Seafield Road, Inverness, IV1 1SG.
